stream_context.summary: Primarily visual-design and optimization work on the new Bowser-themed oil-rig stage (internal nickname "Bowser protest"). Focus on coin placement, crane colors, switch model, massive water/sky background experiment, and real-N64 performance tests.

development_findings.summary: Even without any culling, triangle sorting or collision pruning, the ~8 000-polygon stage runs ~22 FPS on real N64; back-face culling alone is expected to add 5-6 FPS and further optimizations will follow.
development_findings.quote: This is an 8 000 polygon level, no render areas, no back-face culling, and it's still 22. Once we enable culling it'll jump by about five or six.

development_findings.summary: For weeks the entire map was exported as F3D instead of F3DZEX, doubling vertex loads; Kaze just noticed and will re-export, opening more headroom.
development_findings.quote: We were exporting it as an F3D model and not F3DZ2—twice the vertex loads and it still ran fine.

development_findings.summary: Switching to Wiseguy’s Matrix Stack Fix enables true world-space lighting; necessary for directional lights in this level.
development_findings.quote: Use Wiseguy's Matrix Stack Fix—otherwise the light source gets transformed by the camera.

development_findings.summary: New NEMU64 build (2024) now supports GDB, cache emulation, and real-time scene inspection, becoming Kaze’s main debug emulator.
development_findings.quote: NEMU from 2002 got updated—you can even open the GDB debugger right in the plug-in.

development_findings.summary: Memory corruption appears when certain coin formations load; Kaze suspects the yellow-coin model gets unloaded and the camera’s render-focus fails, causing large geometry to disappear. Needs proper fix.
Crane cabins are now dark Bowser-green instead of black or orange; each crane type may get distinct colors for readability.
development_findings.quote: Maybe the demolishing one should be reddish… purple doesn’t look Bowser-y… darkest Bowser color then.

development_findings.summary: Biobak’s replacement ‘floor switch’ model cut polygons from ~4 000 to 1 336 and packs the bevel into a tiny RGBA texture; Kaze adopted it immediately.
development_findings.quote: This actually just looks like an upgraded version of the Mario 64 one—much better and smaller.

development_findings.summary: An extensive sky/water experiment concluded that an NF-BG won’t work because stage geometry touches the horizon. Final approach: giant curved water plane translated ~0.85× camera movement plus fog-matched gradient.
development_findings.quote: I think this is perfect… the water plane moves at 0.85 and the horizon color now blends with the fog.

development_findings.summary: Planned additional optimization: triangle sorting, collision-map reduction, and back-face culling for every gate and pipe.
Merch idea: sell professionally printed N64 boxes & manuals (without ROM) plus an OST-only ROM to remain legal, possibly turning into a ‘full ROM-making company.’
development_findings.quote: I could just sell the box without the ROM and it'd be legal… maybe start hiring people.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prefers C; calls C++ ‘shitty C except for templates,’ reflecting his minimalist, performance-first philosophy.
context_findings.quote: C++ is just a shitty version of C—templates are tolerable, classes are an unnecessary abstraction.

context_findings.summary: Maintains a full-time C-programming day job; progress on RTYI is limited to personal evenings/weekends.
context_findings.quote: I've been working on this a few months now but I have a full-time job on the side.

context_findings.summary: Considers himself a ‘vampire’ indoors type, joking about dying in Florida sun—hinting at heavy workload and indoor life.
context_findings.quote: I'm the whitest man alive—I would die in the sun.

context_findings.summary: Willing to pay contributors once the soundtrack or merch generates revenue, showing cooperative ethos.
context_findings.quote: I was offering to pay the musicians as well, for the rights to the music, once everything's done.

context_findings.summary: Flirts with Twitter Blue monetisation but treats it humorously (‘post stupid bait to pay my bills’).
context_findings.quote: We're gonna be posting more stupid bait… get Twitter Blue and it's gonna pay my bills.

biobak.summary: Suggested color-coding cranes and supplied reference images for horizon gradient and sea illusion.
Modelled a new low-poly, texture-efficient Bowser-level switch that Kaze integrated the same session.
biobak.quote: I've just changed the texture, reduced the triangles—1336 polygons only.

zeina.summary: Absent this stream; otherwise would have finished an NPC animation Kaze is waiting on.
zeina.quote: Unfortunately Zeina's gone today—otherwise she maybe would have finished the animation for the guy here.

key_stories.title: Unexpected Performance Headroom
key_stories.summary: During real-hardware tests Kaze realised the entire level was accidentally exported in an inefficient display-list format yet still hit 30 FPS, revealing unexpected optimisation headroom.
key_stories.process: Noticed smooth-shading flags were wrong, checked exporter, realised F3D was used instead of F3DZEX.
key_stories.outcome: Will re-export correctly, expecting further FPS gains and redesign freedom.
key_stories.key_quote: We were exporting as F3D, not F3DZEX—twice the vertex loads, and it still ran fine.

key_stories.title: The Infinite Ocean Problem
key_stories.summary: Creating an oil-sea that feels endless proved tricky: NF-BGs clipped, fog looked claustrophobic, and skybox parallax was wrong. After many live experiments, Kaze and Biobak settled on a curved water plane that scrolls 0.85× the camera and blends into a custom fog gradient.
key_stories.challenge: Making the horizon look far without breaking N64 culling limits.
key_stories.process: Tried NF-BG, experimented with fog distances, vertex displacement, gradient colours, camera-linked translations, community image references.
key_stories.outcome: Achieved convincing illusion; final tweaks remain for steel-beam silhouettes.
key_stories.key_quote: I think this is perfect—the water plane moves at 0.85 and the horizon colour now blends with the fog.

key_stories.title: Switch Facelift
key_stories.summary: Original Bowser-stage floor switch looked off-centre and over-detailed. Biobak rebuilt it with cleaner UVs and quarter of the polygons, and Kaze replaced the asset live.
key_stories.process: Chat noticed off-centre UVs; Biobak offered a new model; Kaze imported it, chose RGBA texture, adjusted colours.
key_stories.outcome: Visual upgrade and performance savings accepted into build.
key_stories.key_quote: This is so much better—an upgraded version of the Mario 64 one, and tiny.
